citation.article-title: Bacillus tusciae, a new species of thermoacidophilic, facultatively chemolithoautotrophic, hydrogen oxidizing sporeformer from a geothermal area.

p.s: Description of Bacillus tusciae sp. nov.

Bacillus tusciae (Tus.cia.e L. gen.n. tusciae from Tuscia; named after Tuscia, a name used by Romans for the region of central Italy where the Etruscan people (Tuscii) lived and where the organism was found)
Straight, rod-shaped cells 0.8 x 4 to 5 μm, with one lateral flagellum forming broad oval, subterminal endospores, 1.2 x 1.8 μm, distending distinctly the sporangium.
Grampositive in young cultures.
Colonies spreading, cream-white, chalky.
Liquid cultures form a surface pellicle.
A yellow, water soluble pigment with an absorption peak at 410 nm is produced in heavy, autotrophic cultures.
Cell wall of Gram-positive type, without a protein coat.
Poly-β-hydroxybutyric acid formed.
No growth factors required.
Strictly respiratory metabolism, with oxygen as the final electron acceptor.
Cannot grow anaerobically with nitrate.
Nitrate reduced to nitrite.
Either chemolithoautotrophic, using H2 as the electron donor and CO2 as the carbon source, or chemoorganoheterotrophic.
A few organic acids, amino acids and alcohols can serve as sole carbon sources, with ammonium ions as the nitrogen source.
Sugars not metabolized.
Ammonium ions, urea and asparagine utilized as sole nitrogen sources.
Dinitrogen not fixed under microaerophilic conditions.
Hydrogenase inducible, soluble; does not reduce pyridine nucleotides.
CO2 fixed via ribulose-bisphosphate cycle.
Catalase weakly positive; oxidase positive.
Starch not hydrolysed.
No growth in the presence of 1% NaCl.
Growth in the presence of 1% glycine.
Inhibitions of growth by penicillin G (0.04 U⋄ml-1).
Temperature optimum for growth about 55°C no growth at 35 or 65°C.
pH for optimum growth: 4.2 to 4.8.
Weak growth at pH 3.5 or at pH 6.0.
The G + C content of the DNA is 57- 58 mol%.
Isolated from an acidic pond in a solfatara near Lago, province of Grosseto, Italy.
Type strain: strain T2 is designated as the type strain for the species.
It has been deposited at the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Göttingen, FRG, under the accession number 2912.

The description of the type strain is the same as the one given for the species, with the following additions: growth under air with acetate, malonate, butyrate, succinate, malate, oxaloacetate, 2-oxoglutarate, L-isoleucine, L-valine, ethanol, propanol, as sole C-sources.
The G + C content of the DNA is 57.7 mol%.
